[[File:Shinsen 002.jpg|thumb|250px|{{lang|ja|神酒}} (''shinshu'', ''miki'', ''miwa''): two bottles of '''{{l|en|sacramental}} {{l|en|sake}}''' used as a {{l|en|Shinto}} {{l|en|offering}}.]]

===Etymology 1===
{{ja-kanjitab|yomi=o|しん|しゅ}}

Possibly from {{der|ja|ltc|sort=しんしゅ|-}} compound {{m|ltc|神酒|tr={{IPAchar|/ʑiɪn t͡sɨu<sup>X</sup>/}}|lit=god + wine}}.

Alternatively, coined in Japan of {{cog|ltc|-}}-derived elements, as a compound of {{compound|lang=ja|sort=しんしゅ|神|tr1=shin|t1=god, spirit|酒|tr2=shu|t2=wine, liquor, alcohol}}.

The individual character readings are [[漢音#Japanese|kan'on]] ''shin'' + [[呉音#Japanese|goon]] ''shu'', suggesting either an innovation in the reading after borrowing, or a Japanese coinage.

====Pronunciation====
{{ja-pron|yomi=o|しんしゅ|acc=1|acc_ref=DJR|acc2=0|acc2_ref=DJR}}

====Noun====
{{ja-noun|しんしゅ}}

# {{l|en|sacramental}} {{l|en|sake}} used in a {{l|en|Shinto}} ceremony
# {{l|en|ambrosia}}, {{l|en|nectar}}

=====Synonyms=====
* {{ja-r|聖酒|せいしゅ}}: {{l|en|sacramental}} {{l|en|sake}}, sacramental {{l|en|wine}}
* {{ja-r|アンブロシア}}: {{l|en|ambrosia}}
* {{ja-r|ネクター}}: {{l|en|nectar}} of the {{l|en|god}}s

===Etymology 2===
{{ja-kanjitab|yomi=k|み|き}}

From {{inh|ja|ojp|sort=みき|-}}.  Appears in the ''{{w|Kojiki}}'' of 712 CE.  Compound of {{compound|lang=ja|sort=みき|神|tr1=mi|t1=honorific prefix used in spiritual contexts|酒|tr2=ki|t2=wine, liquor, alcohol|pos2=ancient root, not found in many words}}.<ref name="DJR">{{R:Daijirin}}</ref><ref name="DJS">{{R:Daijisen}}</ref><ref name="KDJ">{{R:Kokugo Dai Jiten}}</ref>

====Pronunciation====
{{ja-pron|yomi=k|みき|acc=0|acc_ref=DJR|acc2=1|acc2_ref=DJR}}

====Alternative forms====
* {{ja-l|御酒}}

====Noun====
{{ja-noun|みき}}

# {{l|en|sacramental}} {{l|en|sake}} used in a {{l|en|Shinto}} ceremony
# {{l|en|ambrosia}}, {{l|en|nectar}}

=====Usage notes=====
In {{l|en|Shinto}} contexts, often prefixed with the honorific ''o-'' as {{m|ja|御神酒}}, {{m|ja|大御酒|tr=omiki}}, or ''ō-'' “great” as {{m|ja|大神酒|tr=ōmiki}}.

=====Synonyms=====
* {{ja-r|聖酒|せいしゅ}}: {{l|en|sacramental}} {{l|en|sake}}, sacramental {{l|en|wine}}
* {{ja-r|アンブロシア}}: {{l|en|ambrosia}}
* {{ja-r|ネクター}}: {{l|en|nectar}} of the {{l|en|god}}s

===Etymology 3===
{{ja-kanjitab|yomi=irr|み|わ}}

From {{inh|ja|ojp|sort=みわ|-}}.  Appears in the ''{{w|Man'yōshū}}'' of 759 CE.  Compound of {{compound|lang=ja|sort=みき|神|tr1=mi|t1=honorific prefix used in spiritual contexts|わ|tr2=wa|pos2=a morpheme of uncertain derivation}}.<ref name="DJR">{{R:Daijirin}}</ref><ref name="DJS">{{R:Daijisen}}</ref><ref name="KDJ">{{R:Kokugo Dai Jiten}}</ref>  The final ''wa'' may be related to {{m|ja|泡|tr=awa||bubble}} in reference to the bubbles of {{l|en|fermentation}} (compare {{m|ja|泡盛|tr=awamori|lit=lots of bubbles||Okinawan rice-based strong spirits}}), but this is only speculation.

====Pronunciation====
{{ja-pron|yomi=irr|みわ}}

====Alternative forms====
* {{ja-l|御酒}}

====Noun====
{{ja-noun|みわ}}

# {{lb|ja|sort=みわ|obsolete}} {{l|en|sacramental}} {{l|en|sake}} used in a {{l|en|Shinto}} ceremony
# {{lb|ja|sort=みわ|obsolete}} {{l|en|ambrosia}}, {{l|en|nectar}}

=====Usage notes=====
The ''miwa'' reading appears to be obsolete.
